org.jetel.component.partition

Class CTLRecordPartition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.ctl.CTLAbstractTransform
      • org.jetel.component.partition.CTLRecordPartition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PartitionFunction, Transform

    public abstract class CTLRecordPartition
extends CTLAbstractTransform
implements PartitionFunction
    Base class of all Java transforms generated by CTL-to-Java compiler from CTL transforms in the Patition component.
    See Also:
    PartitionFunction

      • initDelegate

        protected void initDelegate(java.lang.Integer partitionCount)
                     throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Called by init(int, RecordKey) to perform user-specific initialization defined in the CTL transform. The default implementation does nothing, may be overridden by the generated transform class.
        Parameters:
        partitionCount - the number of partitions
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the initialization fails

      • supportsDirectRecord

        public final boolean supportsDirectRecord()
        Description copied from interface: PartitionFunction
        Indicates whether partition function supports operation on serialized records /aka direct
        Specified by:
        supportsDirectRecord in interface PartitionFunction
        Returns:
        true if getOutputPort(ByteBuffer) method can be called

      • getOutputPort

        public final int getOutputPort(DataRecord record)
                        throws TransformException
        Specified by:
        getOutputPort in interface PartitionFunction
        Parameters:
        record - data record which should be used for determining partition??? number
        Returns:
        port number which should be used for sending data out.
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • getOutputPortDelegate

        protected abstract java.lang.Integer getOutputPortDelegate()
                                                    throws ComponentNotReadyException,
                                                           TransformException
        Called by getOutputPort(DataRecord) to perform user-specific partitioning defined in the CTL transform. Has to be overridden by the generated transform class.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if some internal initialization failed
        TransformException - if an error occurred

      • getOutputPortOnError

        public final int getOutputPortOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                       DataRecord record)
                               throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: PartitionFunction
        Called only if PartitionFunction.getOutputPort(DataRecord) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        getOutputPortOnError in interface PartitionFunction
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused PartitionFunction.getOutputPort(DataRecord) to fail

        Returns:
        port number which should be used for sending data out.

                       CloverBuffer buffer)
                               throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: PartitionFunction
        Called only if PartitionFunction.getOutputPort(ByteBuffer) throws an exception.
        Specified by:

      • getOutputPortOnErrorDelegate

        protected java.lang.Integer getOutputPortOnErrorDelegate(java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                             java.lang.String stackTrace)
                                                  throws ComponentNotReadyException,
                                                         TransformException
        Called by getOutputPortOnError(Exception, DataRecord) to perform user-specific partitioning defined in the CTL transform. May be overridden by the generated transform class. Throws UnsupportedOperationException by default.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - an error message of the error message that occurred
        stackTrace - a stack trace of the error message that occurred
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if some internal initialization failed
        TransformException - if an error occurred
